definition: high street (main street of a town or city) (loanword)

sentences.english: High Street separates here into East Street and Elm Street.
sentences.chinese: 高街在此分爲東街和榆樹街。

sentences.english: David Smith, care of Mary Jones, 16, High Street.
sentences.chinese: 高街16號瑪麗瓊斯轉交戴維史密斯。

sentences.english: H&M is well known for bringing high fashion to the high street.
sentences.chinese: 向來以將高端時尚引入高街品牌而著稱。

sentences.english: Just go straight down the High Street, then take the first left, and Bob's your uncle.
sentences.chinese: 沿着高街一直走，在第一個路口左拐就行了。

sentences.english: Well, you are quite close to Kensington High Street.
sentences.chinese: 好的，現在你距離肯辛頓高街相當近。

sentences.english: The virtual changing room is the latest invention attempting to the high street shopping experience.
sentences.chinese: 這項虛擬的試衣鏡是革新了高街購物體驗的最新發明。

definition: to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
(Tw) to wear selected items of clothing in combination to achieve a particular look/fashion styling
